channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 看：唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，他无法为一项针对他的 4.54 亿美元民事欺诈判决获得保释金。华尔街日报》为您解读其中的利害关系。
item.description:
Watch: Donald Trump said he has been unable to obtain a bond for a $454 million civil-fraud judgment against him. WSJ looks at what’s at stake. https://t.co/dabuy7o4iJ https://t.co/dabuy7o4iJ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 科学家正在发现超加工食品如何影响我们大脑的线索
item.description:
Scientists are discovering clues to how ultra-processed food affects our brain https://t.co/cdzevUtR3q https://t.co/cdzevUtR3q

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: "三明治穿衣法 "与蛋黄酱无关，它是一种快速穿衣的时尚策略。以下是一些时尚女性的穿衣之道。
item.description:
"Sandwich dressing" isn't about mayo—it's a fashion strategy for getting dressed fast, and very well. Here's how some very stylish women do it. https://t.co/VIAplHY6X1 https://t.co/VIAplHY6X1

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 男人穿什么最性感（和最不性感）？我们对 2000 名男性和女性进行了调查。剧透远离红色。
item.description:
What are the sexiest (and least sexy) things men can wear? We surveyed 2,000 men and women. Spoiler: Stay away from red. https://t.co/8OljJTVjEF https://t.co/8OljJTVjEF

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: "我太年轻了，不适合变老"。人们不遗余力地减少或阻止白发苍苍的过程。一些研究衰老问题的科学家认为，他们可能有所发现。
item.description:
“I’m too young to be old.” People are going to great lengths to reduce or halt the graying process. Some scientists of aging think they might be onto something. https://t.co/qY48FxlSjw https://t.co/qY48FxlSjw

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 我们毁了性爱吗？五位作家提出了一个问题：在人类最亲密的行为方面，社会是否已经迷失了方向？
item.description:
Have we ruined sex? Five writers ask whether society has lost its way when it comes to the most intimate of human acts. https://t.co/dJhwUC1ims https://t.co/dJhwUC1ims

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

Israel and Hamas are locked in Gaza truce talks with goals that seem impossible to reconcile https://t.co/8ZYGMttU20 https://t.co/8ZYGMttU20

item.title: 医生说，三明治中的火腿片要三思而后行

item.title: 无论您是在寻找经典的 T 恤文胸还是适合正装的无肩带款式，我们的清单都能满足您的需求。
item.description:
Whether you’re looking for a classic T-shirt bra or a formalwear-ready strapless style, our list has something for you. https://t.co/WmHTh0sGrN

— Buy Side from WSJ (@BuySideWSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: "大规模裁员是领导力的失败"。一家公司是如何避免大规模裁员的，即使在大流行病期间其销售额激增 50%，然后崩溃。
item.description:
“Mass layoffs are a failure of leadership.” How one company has avoided them even when its sales surged 50% during the pandemic then collapsed. https://t.co/sfPmc7iwhM https://t.co/sfPmc7iwhM

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 发短讯并不一定要X级。与伴侣谈谈什么感觉舒服，给自己一些时间去适应。
item.description:
Sexting doesn’t have to be X-rated. Talk to your partner about what feels comfortable and give yourself time to get used to it. https://t.co/YVE86JjeJg pic.twitter.com/b9O3xyspTA

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 亚伦-罗杰斯被讨论为副总统候选人？58 岁的迈克-泰森重返拳坛？NBA比赛延迟20分钟？@JasonGay回来了，为您报道一系列糟糕的体育新闻。
item.description:
Aaron Rodgers discussed as a VP candidate? Mike Tyson back in the boxing ring at age 58? A 20-minute delay in an NBA game? @JasonGay is back to tackle a series of lousy sports developments. https://t.co/Jj9dS81zcL https://t.co/Jj9dS81zcL

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 罗伊诉韦德案的判决改变了妇女堕胎的时间、方式和地点，尽管联邦取消了对药物流产的保护，但药物流产变得越来越普遍。
item.description:
The fall of Roe v. Wade changed when, how and where women get abortions, with medication abortions becoming more common despite the elimination of federal protections for the procedure https://t.co/Ou3NZ1da1J https://t.co/Ou3NZ1da1J

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 对于投资者来说，美联储本周会议的最大问题是，由于近期通胀数据坚挺，美联储是否应该再等一等再降息？
item.description:
For investors, the big question hanging over this week’s meeting of the Federal Reserve is whether it should wait a little longer to cut interest rates because of recent, firm inflation readings https://t.co/3Y8WYBOsA0 https://t.co/3Y8WYBOsA0

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 观看：新加坡面积与纽约市相当，与邻国和平相处，但其军费开支却超过东南亚任何其他国家。
item.description:
Watch: It's the same size as New York City and at peace with its neighbors, but Singapore spends more on its military than any other country in Southeast Asia. https://t.co/dtG8sryFcZ https://t.co/dtG8sryFcZ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 在销售冰淇淋 100 多年之后，Ben & Jerry's 的所有者联合利华已经失去了对这项业务的兴趣
item.description:
After more than 100 years of selling ice cream, Ben & Jerry’s owner Unilever has lost its taste for the business https://t.co/Qe0y0CPjCH https://t.co/Qe0y0CPjCH

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 企业希望参议院通过一项包含数十亿美元优惠的税收法案。参议院共和党人不会这么做。
item.description:
Businesses want the Senate to pass a tax bill with billions in breaks. Senate Republicans won’t do it. https://t.co/If4TibpD5C https://t.co/If4TibpD5C

item.description:
The world’s 12-year experiment with negative interest rates is over https://t.co/JMwlCo0vkY https://t.co/JMwlCo0vkY

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 街谈巷议：收购瑞士信贷一年后，一个大问题依然存在："@jonsindreu 问："这将如何改变瑞银？
item.description:
Heard on the Street: One year after acquiring Credit Suisse, one big question lingers: “How will this change UBS?” asks @jonsindreu https://t.co/nj8c5ZP9la https://t.co/nj8c5ZP9la

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 手机数据和其他位置分析技术使公司和业主能够比以往任何时候都更准确地确定成功店铺的位置
item.description:
Cellphone data and other location analytics allow companies and landlords to pinpoint spots for successful stores with greater accuracy than ever before https://t.co/V4WwviBkPH https://t.co/V4WwviBkPH

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 食品创业公司 Wonder 最初计划在全国范围内铺设餐车。现在，它已从投资者那里筹集了 7 亿美元，为其网络增加了近 100 家外卖餐厅。
item.description:
Food startup Wonder initially planned to blanket the nation with food trucks. Now it has raised $700 million from investors to add nearly 100 delivery-focused restaurants to its network. https://t.co/zoOLpLJLiJ https://t.co/zoOLpLJLiJ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普在以色列-哈马斯战争问题上批评了拜登总统，但他并没有说他将如何解决冲突，也没有说冲突结束后应该发生什么。
item.description:
Donald Trump has criticized President Biden on the Israel-Hamas war, but he hasn’t said how he would resolve the conflict—or what should happen when it ends https://t.co/6Gy7yQF3Go https://t.co/6Gy7yQF3Go

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）对两家投资顾问公司处以罚款，原因是这两家公司涉嫌在使用人工智能技术方面做出虚假陈述，这也是该委员会对参与所谓 "人工智能洗白 "的企业发出的警告。
item.description:
The Securities and Exchange Commission has fined two investment advisers for allegedly making false statements about their use of artificial-intelligence technology, following through on its warning to go after businesses involved in so-called “AI washing” https://t.co/7KJa6AScSt

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 在美国贫富不均日益加剧的背景下，全国 200 多个城市和郡县正在试行收入保障计划。
item.description:
More than 200 cities and counties around the country are experimenting with guaranteed-income programs amid growing wealth inequality in the U.S. https://t.co/NGRIQtZJyx https://t.co/NGRIQtZJyx

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 当美国和欧洲为基辅的武器问题争论不休时，一个前苏联卫星国正求助于冷战时期的关系，以帮助乌克兰抵御俄罗斯的进攻
item.description:
While the U.S. and Europe argue over weapons for Kyiv, one former Soviet satellite state is turning to Cold War contacts to help Ukraine hold back Russia https://t.co/ZeSCCLQ8BX https://t.co/ZeSCCLQ8BX

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 为了吸引特斯拉，印度降低了某些电动汽车的进口关税，只要制造商在印度投资至少 5 亿美元生产汽车即可。
item.description:
In a step largely aimed at wooing Tesla, India slashed import duties on certain electric vehicles for manufacturers who invest at least $500 million to produce their cars in the country https://t.co/xTcX6HJLdQ https://t.co/xTcX6HJLdQ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰军队疲惫不堪，美国援助停滞不前，乌克兰面临着如何抵御规模更大、装备更精良的俄罗斯军队的问题
item.description:
With its military worn down and U.S. aid stalled, Ukraine confronts how to hold off the larger and better-equipped Russian army https://t.co/54IE5KjpIM https://t.co/54IE5KjpIM

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: "风往哪儿吹，我们就往哪儿去"。没有债务，坐拥巨额存款，DINKs--"双职工，无子女 "夫妇--正在夸耀频繁旅行、财务自由和慷慨赠与的美德。
item.description:
"We go where the wind blows." Free of debt and sitting on hefty savings, DINKs—"dual income, no kids" couples—are boasting the virtues of frequent travel, financial freedom and generous gifting. https://t.co/5zXDMKrpm1 https://t.co/5zXDMKrpm1

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024
